quest.name: Fragments of Truth
journal: Urianger would speak with you regarding your mission to prevent Bahamut's return.

You have scarcely exchanged two sentences with Urianger when Alisaie appears seeking the Archon's counsel on how to gain entry to the remaining internment hulks. Urianger suggests that she return to the connecting fragments of Dalamud in your company, in hopes that your presence will set events in motion, as it has so often in the past. In the meantime, the Archon promises to seek answers of his own. Make your way to the fragment situated at the Burning Wall in eastern Thanalan, and speak with Alisaie's assistant who has been reconnoitering the site.

To your disappointment, Alisaie's assistant reports that he has been unable to identify a viable path to the fragment's exterior, let alone a means to access its interior. Just as you are about to leave for Mor Dhona, where the next fragment lies, he adds that he has lost contact with his brother there. Make haste to the Singing Shards, and ensure that the man does not come to harm.

You arrive at the Singing Shards just in time to prevent Alisaie's second assistant from coming to a sticky end. Unfortunately, the news he has for you is not good. If the fellow is to be believed, there will be no entering the fragment of Dalamud in Mor Dhona. Moments later, however, Urianger contacts you via linkpearl to notify you that he may have found a way to breach the remaining fragments. Make haste to the Ceruleum Processing Plant in northern Thanalan, where the Archon will furnish you with the details.

Urianger explains to you the method which he and certain other nameless individuals have conceived to reach the remaining internment hulks. Requiring that the laws of aetherial travel be bent to breaking point, the process entails considerable danger, but Alisaie is willing to take the risk. Meet her at the crystal formation known as Dalamud's Talons situated to the north of the plant.

Alphinaud arrives at Dalamud's Talons shortly after you do, revealing himself to be Urianger's mysterious collaborator. Having questioned his twin on the origin of her resolve, he declares that he will be joining your party on this descent into the Binding Coil. Speak with Erkenrad at the Ceruleum Processing Plant when you are ready to embark upon your mission.

Erkenrad acknowledges your readiness. At your word, you and your comrades will be transported directly inside the first of the two remaining internment hulks. Upon arrival, you must make your way to the main bridge and disable the coil responsible for Bahamut's regeneration. Spare no preparation and expect fierce resistance.

※The Final Coil of Bahamut can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
objectives: Speak with Alisaie's assistant at the Burning Wall.
Rescue Alisaie's assistant at the Singing Shards.
Speak with Urianger at the Ceruleum Processing Plant.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Man is wont to cast light wheresoever secrets lie hid in darkness─though that which he illuminateth seldom bringeth him joy. So it is with such unhappy truths as Bahamut's immense shadow doth conceal.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Yet ever onward forgeth Mistress Alisaie, undeterred by the burden of knowledge that weigheth heavy on her heart. 'Tis a perilous path she hath chosen, and a painful one. I prithee, Forename, remain by her side as her valiant blade, that she might see her quest to its conclusion.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Forename─it is well that you are here.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: My lady. How might I serve you this day?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I have met with some difficulty in my mission, Urianger, and I should be grateful for your counsel.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: As you know, Bahamut's physical form is regenerating beneath the Carteneau Flats even as we speak.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If we are to prevent his return, we must needs disable the two remaining internment hulks that sustain him.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Every moment our mission is delayed, the realm is pushed closer to the brink of destruction.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alas, though I have determined the locations of the fragments of Dalamud leading to the hulks, I have been unable to find a way to enter them.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: ...And gaining admittance is but the first step in your perilous undertaking.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: When last thou descended into Bahamut's subterranean fastness, thou didst discover, didst thou not, that the dread primal had bound the shade of Nael van Darnus unto his will.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: And though thou didst consign the fallen legatus to blessed oblivion, thou mayest recall that the piteous wretch was not alone. Doubt not but that Bahamut's other thralls shall seek to hinder thy passage.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...You can say his name, Urianger. I have not forgotten that my grandfather is waiting for us.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: My lady. I would remind you, as I must oft remind myself, that the man whom we both loved and revered is no more. What remaineth is but a shade which defileth his memory.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The vile verbiage that spilleth from his lips must not be heeded, for it cometh not from your grandsire, but from Bahamut himself.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You need not worry, Urianger. Come what may, I will not stray from the course.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I will not let Grandfather's sacrifice be in vain!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: <sigh> But mere words will not take us whither we must go. As I said, I have been unable to find a way to enter the fragments of Dalamud...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: My lady, might I suggest that you visit the fragments again in Forename's company? Full oft hath the Warrior of Light set events in motion by virtue of herhis presence alone. 'Tis possible that shehe may do so again.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I, the while, shall search for answers of mine own. By our efforts combined, full sure am I that the path shall be revealed to us ere long.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...Were it anyone else, I should question the wisdom of such advice. Yet I cannot deny that what you say about Forename is true... Very well, I shall do as you suggest.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...Assuming you have no objections, of course? Good. Now, we seek entry to two fragments of Dalamud. One lies at the Burning Wall in eastern Thanalan, and the other at the Singing Shards in Mor Dhona.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I left an assistant at each location with instructions to continue searching for a means of ingress. It is not impossible that they could since have found something useful to us. Let us begin by visiting my man at the Burning Wall. Deks, I think it was.

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORA00043
dialogue.text: I say, are you not MistressMaster Surname, my lady's most faithful companion? Sinis, madamsir, at your service! And may I say what an honor it is to meet you!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: How goes the survey, Deks?

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORA00043
dialogue.text: Ahem. My lady! It shames me to say that I have found no viable path to the fragment.

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORA00043
dialogue.text: Though it stands there, before our very eyes, the way thither has thus far proven impassable.

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORA00043
dialogue.text: When the fragment fell and pierced the land, it caused a prodigious amount of aether to spew forth.

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORA00043
dialogue.text: 'Twas this that gave rise to the land's twisted lay, which seems destined to thwart our efforts.

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORA00043
dialogue.text: Even were an opening to exist, I fear that we would struggle to reach it.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We cannot give up. Keep trying.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So near and yet so far... Well, it avails us naught to stand here and stare at the thing. Let us away to Mor Dhona, and try the other fragment. Perhaps Sinis has fared better.

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORA00043
dialogue.text: Ah! U-Upon that note, my lady, there is something I must tell you. I am sorry to report that I lost contact with my brother just over a bell ago...

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORA00043
dialogue.text: A-As you know, the Singing Shards are home to many fell creatures, ogres among them... While I do not wish to cause you undue alarm, I fear something unspeakable may have happened to Deks.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What!? Why didn't you─!? Give me strength!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We must hurry to my assistant's aid, Forename.

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORA00043
dialogue.text: The Singing Shards are home to a host of fell creatures, ogres among them... If it would not be too much trouble, I should be most grateful if you would find my brother and keep my lady safe.

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORB00043
dialogue.text: Thank you, adventurer! For a moment there, I feared that my bones were to be ground up and used to bake bread!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I am relieved to see that you are unharmed. It was wrong of me to press such a dangerous task upon you.

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORB00043
dialogue.text: M-M-My lady! Your worries are wasted on me! 'Twas nothing at all, I assure you!

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORB00043
dialogue.text: Ahem! If it please you, I shall report on my findings.

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORB00043
dialogue.text: As you can see, though the tip of the fragment is exposed, the rest is encased in rock and crystal, rendering it impossible to enter the structure.

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORB00043
dialogue.text: We might try excavating the area around the fragment, but that is like to take time─and there really is no telling how deep we may need to dig before we find a suitable point of ingress.

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORB00043
dialogue.text: As such, I am forced to conclude that gaining entry to this fragment is unrealistic. Forgive me, my lady.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Confound it... We are losing precious time. What are we to do now?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis I, Urianger. Glad tidings have I for thee and my lady.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: For a blessing, a way hath been found by which thou mayest enter the remaining fragments of Dalamud.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Pray escort Mistress Alisaie to the Ceruleum Processing Plant in northern Thanalan. There, all shall be made clear.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Urianger has found a way!?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Then we must go to him at once!

dialogue.name: INVESTIGATORB00043
dialogue.text: You needn't linger on my account. Should Master Urianger's method prove viable, rest assured I shall put many malms between myself and this place.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Mine apologies for summoning you thus from afar, my lady, but 'tis here that your journey may finally begin.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I did wonder. To my knowledge, there are no fragments in northern Thanalan.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Nor are you mistaken, my lady. Yet a pathway doth exist─one which you yourself have made use of in the past.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: At the conclusion of your several forays into the Binding Coil, 'twas at the crystal formation which lieth to the north of this place that you did emerge, was it not?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Yes. An aetherial stream bore us back to the surface─that much I had surmised. Are you suggesting that we can use it to return underground?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: And even if that were possible, would it not simply bear us back to those places which we have already explored?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: It need not, my lady. Pray allow me to explain. Upon the evidence of your experience, it seemeth plain that two internment hulks may share the selfsame aetherial egress. From this, we did infer that others may be connected in like wise. Thus did we labor long to verify the existence of further tributaries to the selfsame stream─in which task we were at length successful. 'Twas then but a matter of arriving at a solution to the problem of traveling to an unattuned destination...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: That one might reach what we may call the headwater, we propose to employ a modified aetheryte which serveth to amplify such ripples as do originate from said source. By focusing one's essence upon these ripples, it should be possible to make the journey. Yet be fairly warned, my lady: as with all untried modes of aetherial travel, this method entaileth considerable danger. Merely to attempt the voyage could cost you your life.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That is a risk I am willing to take! You are brilliant, Urianger!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But I am curious... Did you have assistance in forming this plan? I could not help noticing your repeated use of the word “we”─unless you have taken to using the majestic plural in our absence?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: ...Ah. Ahem. Nay, my lady. As you have correctly surmised...I was not alone in this endeavor.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...Meaning there are others who are aware of our mission.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, it cannot be helped now. Preventing Bahamut's return is what matters. If some secrecy must be sacrificed to achieve our goal, then so be it.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Verily, 'twas not my wish to withhold knowledge of the aid I received... I pray that Mistress Alisaie will forgive me when she learneth of its source...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So that must be the modified aetheryte. But what are the Immortal Flames doing here...?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-???-)Those men may be sworn Flames of Ul'dah, but they are first and foremost faithful retainers of House Leveilleur.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alphinaud!? So it was you who was helping Urianger!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Who else could it have been, dear sister?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Lest you worry, I have no intention of making the details of your venture public. Like you, I would prefer to avoid causing a panic.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But given that which is at stake─namely, the survival of the realm─one must be willing to accept help when it is offered. Would you not agree?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: At the very least, do not be cross with Urianger─'twas at my behest that he kept silent.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Hmph! We will speak later!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Pray forgive me, my lady, but knowing full well your intent, I judged it meet that Master Alphinaud be informed.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Though your grandsire hath become Bahamut's thrall, his noble blood courseth yet through both your veins, and if he must needs be struck down─

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Do you hear that, Alphinaud? I mean to strike down Grandfather! And when I have done so, I shall banish Bahamut to the aether!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Nothing you say will sway me from my course! I will protect Eorzea, and I will uphold Grandfather's legacy!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Grandfather's legacy...? So you still do not know what you yourself desire. Your actions are still driven by borrowed resolve.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Borrowed resolve!? What does that have to do with anything!?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Protecting Eorzea was Grandfather's goal, and we made it ours─both of us! That is why we came here, unless you have forgotten!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Gods forbid I should ever forget, Alisaie. But you misunderstand. I do not question your resolve, only whence it came. If it were your own, you would be able to tell me precisely why you desire so fervently to protect Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Yet you cannot, for it is not your resolve, but Grandfather's. You may struggle to see the difference, but borrowed resolve shall never be as strong as that which springs from within.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...But let us speak of this another time. For now, preventing Bahamut's return is all that matters.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: To be plain, I have no objection to striking down whatever is left of Grandfather. Know, however, that I will be accompanying you this time. As a son of House Leveilleur, I would be present for his final moments.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...Very well. You may join us...on one condition: I make the decisions.

dialogue.name: ERKENRAD
dialogue.text: If it please milady, the name's Erkenrad. Our preparations are just about complete.

dialogue.name: ERKENRAD
dialogue.text: When you're ready to embark on your mission, just give me the word. I'll be waiting for you at the Ceruleum Processing Plant.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Pay no heed to my brother. You can rely on me. We have come far together, you and I, and together we shall see our journey to its end.

dialogue.name: ERKENRAD
dialogue.text: I've been waiting for you, MistressMaster Surname. I'm pleased to say that the aetheryte's primed and ready.

dialogue.name: ERKENRAD
dialogue.text: As you know, the remaining internment hulks are connected to the fragments in eastern Thanalan and Mor Dhona. It's to the former that we'll be sending you first.

dialogue.name: ERKENRAD
dialogue.text: Now, you'll be starting inside the hulk, meaning you won't have to cover so much ground─the drawback being that you'll be fighting for your life from the moment you get there. Best be prepared for anything, for milady's sake if not your own.

dialogue.name: ERKENRAD
dialogue.text: And that's about all I can tell you. When your preparations are in order, just give me the word, and I'll send you on your way. I may even throw in a prayer for your speedy return just to be on the safe side.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to the Final Coil of Bahamut. The subterranean labyrinth can be accessed by speaking with Erkenrad.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: For details such as the conditions of entry, speak with the flame sergeant.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So this is how it looks on the inside...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This internment hulk still functions...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The teleportation was a success─we are come to the right place.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There is no telling how much further Bahamut has regenerated since we last beheld him.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Let us make haste to the main bridge and deactivate the coil.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There were receptacles similar to these in the previous hulk.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Those held chimerical beasts, but only the Allagans know what other abominations may be sleeping within.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: They may well be part of Dalamud's internal defenses. We must stay on our guard at all times.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: By the Twelve... Dragons...and so many...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We were aware that the Allagans possessed the means to control the creatures, but to imprison them thus is...barbaric. I would not wish such a fate upon my worst enemy.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: 'Tis plain that no love was lost between the Allagans and the dragons, but was it truly necessary to keep so great a number here?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Dalamud did not want for defenses, this we have experienced firsthand. Such guardians as the Allagans created─both living and unliving─were surely no less capable of repelling intruders than these poor creatures...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Tell me something, Alisaie.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Have you not managed to determine by whose will Bahamut exists?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: No, I have not. At first, I assumed that Bahamut had no people of his own─that the Allagans had perhaps discovered a way to simulate prayer itself.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: However, Nael's words gave me cause to reconsider─specifically, the shade's mention of Bahamut's “beloved children.”

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: From that, I inferred that the primal is given form by the will of worshipers whom we have yet to─

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Gods strike me down for a blind fool!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Bahamut's beloved children, right there before my very eyes... How could I be so stupid?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Who else but the dragons of eld would summon Bahamut? Who else but they could sustain him? And to think I wondered why the Allagans kept them imprisoned here!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Even should the flame of Bahamut's life go out, his faithful children would summon him back.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: For this reason, the Allagan Empire kept an army of dragons here in a perpetual state of duress, that they might sustain the primal's existence.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Truly, the Allagans' ingenuity knew no bounds...and neither did their cruelty.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Small wonder that Bahamut was so enraged! Let no one deny that it was man who sowed the seeds of the Calamity!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Will you now turn your hatred towards our own kind, dear sister?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Do not patronize me, Alphinaud. I merely acknowledge our guilt.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Lest you be in any doubt, I have no intention of allowing Bahamut to lay the world to waste, regardless of the atrocities the Allagans committed against his kind. We have no choice but to eliminate all who worship him, be they his children or his thralls.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It seems reasonable to assume that the system responsible for the primal's regeneration is also responsible for sustaining the captive dragons. If we disable it, all should perish. Let us press on.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Why, this looks like...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: A model of Dalamud, yes.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: For millennia, Bahamut must have gazed at this unchanging view.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Trapped inside a prison that was scarcely large enough to contain him, unable to move, denied the release of death... How his hatred for man must have burned.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: And that hatred found an ideal vessel in Nael van Darnus.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: In many ways, Bahamut is to be pitied, not loathed. But knowing the true extent of his fury, I am more convinced than ever of the necessity of our endeavor.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Besides...his is not the only soul that cries out for vengeance!

obj.n: The Final Coil of Bahamut - Turn 1
